intro: Sida blitoides, commonly known as the hairy sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Its hairy stems and leaves are characteristic features, and it produces small, yellowish flowers. Sida blitoides is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
